technology.short_description: As regiments gain renown, their standards become talismans that are just as important as their sword-arms.
State Troops are often issued with armour plate to ensure unit cohesion and a reasonable level of protection.
It is the duty of each province to maintain a provincial army, which together make up the might of the Imperial Army.
The Empire must remain the mainstay of humanity in the Old World regardless of those who do not obey the law.

effects.description: "Imperial Allegiance" melee damage reflection for infantry units

technology.short_description: Born as the twin-tailed comet blazed in the sky, Sigmar Heldenhammer united the tribes of warring humans and founded the Empire, and according to the cult of Sigmar, was elevated to Godhood.

effects.description: Control: +2 in own provinces where an army is present
Allows to chose one of four factionwide army abilities
Only one major deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Imperial God of War, Winter, and Wolves, who has ever protected the northern regions of the Empire from its enemies.

effects.description: Control: +2 in own provinces where an army is present
Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units
Allows to chose one of four factionwide army abilities
Only one major deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Empire must remain the mainstay of humanity in the Old World regardless of those who do not obey the law.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -10%
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: There's always a new market to be tapped, or a fresh approach to existing ones.

The Empire is a bastion of civilization, holding back terrors too horrible to describe. Its cities are among the safest in the world, and their development must be swift to hold back the tide of evil.
Selective breeding allows the Empire to have good supply of steeds, capable of carrying heavily-armoured Knights into battle.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units
Recruitment cost: -15% for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units

technology.short_description: An army can only march as far as its supplies will last. Wagons loaded with goods allow for larger forces.
Refined ore techniques create stronger steel, making for more durable blades and heavier weapon-heads.

effects.description: Attribute: Expert Charge Defence for Halberdier units

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

technology.short_description: Although the cost falls to each individual soldier, it is expected that all will use standardised equipment.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for melee infantry units
Charge bonus: +10% for melee infantry units

technology.short_description: For the vanguard forces of the Imperial army, and for the state troops tasked with holding the flanks against the terrifying monstrosities of the enemies of the Empire, an extra bit of protection can go a long way.
A rebate is a useful tool when things are good to ensure compliance during the hard times inevitably just around the corner.
It's comforting for people to know where their next meal will come from when winter's chill descends.
This joint-stock enterprise, if the trade winds prevail, is bound to make both factors and shareholders filthy, stinking rich. Amen.
Advancements in the field of cartography have allowed the Empire to improve the accuracy of their maps, ensuring their troops always know the most efficient way to their destination.
When he was a man, none could stand before his wrath. As a God ascended, none ever will.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

technology.short_description: Every Ulrican can fight, but when they receive their God’s blessing, they become the most fearsome warriors in the world.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: The bravest, most-accomplished warriors do not always come from among the nobility, but must get their start somewhere.
Used for menial tasks such as fetching supplies or performing mundane rituals, these young Imperial citizens can contribute to the war effort.
One god, one way, many agents to guarantee compliance in defence of the faith.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +4 for Warrior Priests
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Witch Hunters

technology.short_description: Lords rule and live well, peasants work themselves to death and must pay for the privilege – it's the perfect model for any truly forward-looking society.

effects.description:
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
	(own armies factionwide)

technology.short_description: Thicker plates for riders and scaled barding for their mounts, meaning a greater percentage survive to charge again.
Riding for days whilst bearing full kit increases one's stamina for the real thing.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -15% for cavalry units

technology.short_description: The loyalty of a demigryph is not easily won. Those that succeed in taming them--though scarred for life from the effort--have earned themselves a fierce and noble companion. Both rider and beast will defend each other to the death.
The Empire must remain the mainstay of humanity in the Old World regardless of those who do not obey the law.

effects.description: "Imperial Allegiance" physical resistance for cavalry units

technology.short_description: Sigmar’s will and determination will manifest within all loyal soldiers of the Empire, allowing them to banish evil from this world.

attributes.bullet_text:
This unit is permanently visible to the enemy, regardless of line of sight.
	
	Revealed units are not affected by the following attributes:
	 Hide Forest
	 Stalk
	 Unspottable
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: In the North, even on a calm day, those who threaten the Empire will find themselves at the mercy of Ulric’s wrath
What a mount cannot see will not spook them, ensuring every charge hits the target squarely.
The Knights of the Inner Circle are the elite of the elite, amongst the best fighting men of the Empire.
To have completed their quests and obtained a demigryph establishes a knight as the apex of their order.
As a young man, Sigmar was once sent to Morr’s gate, though he did not pass through. As a God, he can persuade his faithful to delay their passage.

effects.description: Army ability: "Safeguard of the Black gate"

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

ui_effects.localised_text: Unit is invulnerable to damage (does not apply to summoned units)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

technology.short_description: The God of Wolves has many servants, and many forms.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summon the White Wolf (aspect of Ulric that deals massive damage to single entities in melee and have attack aura for allies)

technology.short_description: The Empire must remain the mainstay of humanity in the Old World regardless of those who do not obey the law.

effects.description:
Attribute: Immune to Psychology
	(all characters factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: Being able to share acquired knowledge among your peers can only lead to better results all round.
Interchangeable parts and constant work shifts ensure production targets are met or even exceeded.
The greatest minds of the Old World are gathered by the Empire’s various institutions to impart their knowledge and methods of efficiency.

effects.description: Income from Iron, Gem and Gold Mines: +15%

technology.short_description: The Imperial Architects are an eccentric bunch who have always had, well, let's say 'fanciful' ideas about how a building should look…
No creature, no matter how fell, can withstand the will of Sigmar.
With reckless abandon, Ulric’s followers throw themselves into battle.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

technology.short_description: This progressive assembly enables swifter production of all manner of industrial goods.
Well regarded not only by their subjects, but also the nobility abroad.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: But how’s your footwork? If I step here… very good. And now I step again...
Constant drilling of recruits, young and old, helps turn them into the well-practiced soldiers expected in an army of the Empire.
Packing a wallop when they strike, artillery crews are also measured on their firing rates; the faster the better.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for artillery units

technology.short_description: More barrels, more chances to knock enemy blocks clean off – it's simply a matter of arithmetic.

effects.description: Explosive missile damage: +10% for artillery units

technology.short_description: The School of Engineers has created a new method of production, allowing even more artillery units to be shipped to the frontlines.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, Helstorm Rocket Battery, Luminark of Hysh, Steam Tank and War Wagon
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Steam Tank, War Wagon and Luminark of Hysh units

technology.short_description: The Empire must remain the mainstay of humanity in the Old World regardless of those who do not obey the law.
This colonial campus maintains the high standards taught within the Imperial Colleges of Magic back home.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +4 for Empire Captains
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Battle Wizards

technology.short_description: "An eighth of an ounce of this, a pinch of that, and half a pound of the other and… Boom! We have ignition!"

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, Helstorm Rocket Battery, Luminark of Hysh, Steam Tank and War Wagon
Leadership: +4 when laying siege or encircling

technology.short_description: A more efficient way of transferring force from gas under pressure speeds up the production process, meaning more steam-powered weapons ready for the fight.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for artillery units
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Steam Tank, War Wagon and Luminark of Hysh units

technology.short_description: Intelligence shared is intelligence doubled.
When the enemy might be an enormous monster taller than the highest spire, it's a good idea not to run out of ammo!
Even the largest hulking war machine can be made more resilient to attack.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Steam Tank and War Wagon units

technology.short_description: Though they often annoy the troops, having a master engineer around always keeps the war machines running smoothly.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +20% for artillery units

technology.short_description: Morr defends the souls of the departed, and protects the minds of dreamers.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when attacking
	(all characters factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: Verena values Justice and Knowledge, and is the patron God of the fair and wise.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The God of Nature and Lord of Beasts, worshipped by hunters and rangers, is extremely temperamental. His rages, when turned against the enemies of his followers, can be devastating.

effects.description: Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Goddess of Fertility, Earth, and Love, and wife of Taal, Rhya provides favorable conditions to the farmers and ranchers who worship her, and protects them from her husband’s rage.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Empire must remain the mainstay of humanity in the Old World regardless of those who do not obey the law.

required_tech_keys.name: Emissary to the Prince of Altdorf
Ambassador to the Royarch of Bretonnia

technology.onscreen_name: Emissary to the Prince of Altdorf
technology.short_description: This trusted advisor, whose loyalty is beyond reproach, knows the Emperor's mind almost as well as Karl Franz himself!

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with Empire, Kislev and Southern Realms

technology.short_description: Successful dealings with the lofty, aloof Asur takes a certain type of individual if awkward diplomatic misunderstandings are to be avoided.
Diplomatic and discreet, this one knows exactly how to deal with fiery Dwarfen temperaments, so is well placed to run the Imperial embassy to the Everlasting Realm.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Such groups are formed so that knowledge and experience can be shared for the betterment of all their members.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for all Imperial Supplies units

technology.short_description: Fledgling colonists must be supplied from back home in the Old World until the Empire's mark is firmly made upon its new lands.
Industrialised production of ammunition for handguns has allowed the Empire to hoard large supplies.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers, Handgunners, Pistoliers and Outriders missile units

technology.short_description: Fixing arms atop mounts and rides does away with the need to dismount and set up prior to firing, in turn reducing vulnerability and increasing efficiency.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% for Pistoliers and Outriders units
Missile strength: +10% for Pistoliers and Outriders units

technology.short_description: The further away you’re able to hit them in the eyes, the better. Trust me, you don’t want these things getting close to you.
The Empire must remain the mainstay of humanity in the Old World regardless of those who do not obey the law.
The Goddess of Strategy and War, Myrmidia values military professionalism, with an emphasis on proper utilization of strategy, tactics, and obedience.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Imperial God of the Seas and Tides, it would be unwise to venture into his domain without properly worshipping him.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: Foul Greenskins, flea-infested Skaven, gluttonous Ogres and slimy Lizardmen are abroad in sufficient numbers that an organised cull is now necessary.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen
Melee defence: +4 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: The lands of the distant East are virtually unknown in the Empire. If the rumors are true this delegation may be the most important group of diplomats in living memory

effects.description: Income from trade: +2% for every ally

technology.onscreen_name: Ambassador to the Royarch of Bretonnia
technology.short_description: Deferent and respectful, the embassy to Bretonnia understands perfectly the customs and traditions of this ancient feudal society.
Missile units who train together excel at firing a deadly hail, so not all members of a regiment have to see the target.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers, Handgunners, Pistoliers and Outriders units

technology.short_description: The discovery of barrel-rifling led to increases in speed and accuracy. Both Dwarfs and men claim credit for this invention.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers and Handgunners units

technology.short_description: Arrows, bolts, bullets, and blackpowder are stored in the watchtowers, barracks, and along the walls. The Empire will not fall from lack of ammunition!

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% when under siege

technology.short_description: The Goddess of Healing and Mercy, her temples are a haven for the poor and sick. Often, those that turn to her temples for mercy will ultimately find comfort in the care of her father, Morr.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -20% for Lore of Life spells
Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Trickster God is the patron of thieves, conmen, and gamblers, and rewards those who are particularly clever. He abhors the pomp and majesty associated with most other cults.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: There may be fell Necromancy afoot, for the Undead and Unliving infest Imperial territory in too greater numbers, hastening the need for an immediate purge.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Undead

technology.short_description: These lands belong to the Empire – those arrogant, knife-eared Elves must be driven back to their own dominion, and with haste!

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Elves

technology.short_description: The taint of Chaos has been observed here; such things must not be allowed to gain a foothold and be removed without delay!

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen
Weapon strength: +10% for all units when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen

technology.short_description: A vital foothold in new territory and a home-from-home for Imperial subjects abroad on colonial business.
If you've got a problem and no one else can help… call the Empire's best to settle the issue once and for all!

effects.description: Receive an additional detachment of reinforcements with every Imperial Supplies delivery
